alert.note: Alert for King George; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 6:35PM EDT until July 01 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... King George County in central Virginia... Southeastern Stafford County in northern Virginia... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 635 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain that has led to multiple areas flooded along Kings Highway and Rt. 3. Between 3.5 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... King George... Fairview Beach... Passapatanzy... Dogue... Lambs Creek... Weedonville... Jersey... Sealston... Shiloh... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
